questions.question: The Mughal school of painting formed the spinal column of different schools of Indian miniature art. Which one of the following painting styles was not affected by Mughal painting? [1995]

Who among the following were famous jurists ofmedieval India? ⏩1 (1) Vljnanesvara   ⏩1 (2) Hemadri ⏩1 (3) Rajasekhara  ⏩1 (4) Jimutavahana ⏩1 Select the correct answer using the codes given below:   [1995]
Which one of the following monuments has a dome which is said to be one of the largest in the world? [1995]
Ashtapradhan was a council of ministers:
The term 'Apabhramsa' was used in medieval Sanskrit texts to denote: [1996]
choices: early forms of some of the modern Indian language

questions.question: Nastaliq was:
choices: a persian script used in medieval India
a cess levied by the Mughal rulers
a manual of code of conduct for the Ulemas

questions.question: The sufi saint who maintained that devotional music was one way of coming close to God was; [1996]
Mughal painting reached its zenith under:
In medieval India, Mansabdari system was introduced for:

After consolidating his power, Balban assumed the grand title of :  [1997]

Assertion : The sponsor and the most prominent figure of the Chisti order of Sufis in India is Khwaja Moinuddin Chisti. Reason (R): The Chisti order takes its name from a village Chisti in Ajmer. In the context of the above two statements, which one of the following is correct? [1997]
choices: Both A and R are true but R is the correct explanation of A
Both A and R are true but R is not the correct explanation of A
A is true but R is false
A is false but R is true

questions.question: Which one of the following pairs of composers in different languages and their works on the Mahabharata theme is correctly matched? [1997]
The medieval Indian writer who refers to the discovery of America is . [1997]
The member of Shivaji's Ashtapradhan who looked after foreign affairs was:  [1998]
The loss of Qandhar was a big blow to the Mughal empire from the view point of:  [1998]
Fawazil in the Sultanate period meant:  [1998]
choices: revenue assigned in lieu of salary
excess amount paid to the exchequer by the Iqtadars
illegal exactions extracted from the peasants

questions.question: Sultan of Delhi who is reputed to have built the biggest network ofcanals in India was: [1998]
⏩1 Assertion :At first theTurkish administrationin India was essentially military.  ⏩1 Reason (R): The country was parcelled out as 'Iqtas' among leading military leaders. [1998]
choices: Both A and R are true but R is the correct explanation of A
Both A and R are true but R is not the correct explanation of A
A is true but R is false
A is false but R is true

questions.question: ⏩1Assertion : During the reign of Shahjahan, Dara Sikoh was sent on expedition to Balkha, Badakhshan and Qandahar. ⏩1 Reason (R): The expedition sent by Shahjahan to the Middle-East was a marvellous success. [1998]
choices: Both A and R are true but R is the correct explanation of A
Both A and R are true but R is not the correct explanation of A
A is true but R is false
A is false but R is true

questions.question: Consider the following: ⏩1 l. Tughlaqabad fort ⏩1 2 Lodi Garden  ⏩1 3. Qutab Minar  ⏩1 4. Fatehpur Sikri  ⏩1 The correct chronological order in which they were built is : [1998]
The first writer to use Urdu as the medium of poetic expression was: [1999]
One consistent feature found in the history of southern India was the growth of small regional kingdoms rather than large kingdoms because of: [1999]
choices: too many divisions in the social structure
absence of vast areas of fertile land

questions.question: 'The king was freed from his people and they from their king'. On whose death did Badauni comment thus? [1999]
Who among the  following streamlined the Maratha administration after Sambhaji ? [2000]
Which one of the following Muslim rulers was hailed as the 'Jagadguru' by his Muslim subject because of his belief in secularism?     [2000]
Mongols under Chengiz Khan invaded India during the reign of :   [2001]
Which among the following ports was called Babul Makka (Gate of Makka) during the Mughal period? [2001]
Which of the following pairs is correctly matched? [2001]
Who among the following was the first Bhakti saint to use Hindi for the propagation of his message? [2002]
With reference to medieval Indian rulers, which one of the following statement is correct? [2002]
choices: Alauddin Khalji first setup a separate ariz's department.
Balban introduced the branding ofhorses in his military.
Muhammad Bin Tughlaq was succeeded by his uncle to the military
Firoz Tughlaq set up a separate department of slaves.

questions.question: The motive behind Shah Jahan's Balkh campaign was to:  [2002]
choices: secure a friendly ruler in Balkh and Badakshan which bordered Kabul
conquer Samarqand and Farghana, the Mughal homelands
fix the Mughal frontier on the 'scientific line', the Amu Daria
expand the Mughal Empire beyond the sub-continent

questions.question: Historian Barani refused to consider the state in India under Delhi Sultans as truly Islamic because: [2002]
choices: majority of the population did not follow Islam
Sultan supplemented the Muslim law by framing his own regulations
religious freedom was accorded to non-muslims

questions.question: With reference to Sufflsm in Indian history, consider the following statements: [2002] ⏩1 1. SheikhAhmad Sarhandi was a contemporary of Ibrahim Lodi⏩1  2. Sheikh Nasiruddin Chirag-I-Dehlavi was a disciple of Sheikh Nizamuddin Auliya ⏩1 3. Aurangzeb was a contemporary ofSheikh Salim Chisti ⏩1 4. Qadiri order of Sufis was first introduced in India by Sheikh Niamutullah and Makhdum Muhammad Jilani ⏩1 Which of these statements are correct?
Alam Khan, one of those who invited Babur to invade India [2003] was:
choices: an uncle of Ibrahim Lodi and a pretender to the throne of Delhi
a cousin of Ibrahim Lodi who ill-treated and expelled from the country
the father of Dilawar Khan to whom cruel treatment was meted out by Ibrahim Lodi
a high official in Punjab province who was discontented with Ibrahim Lodi's treatment to his tribe

questions.question: Battle of Dharmat was fought between:
choices: Ahmad Shah Durrani and the Marathas

questions.question: How did the Mughal Emperor Jahandarshah's reign, come to an early end? [2003]
choices: He was deposed by his Wazir
He died due to a slip while climbing down the steps
He was defeated by his nephew in a battle
He died of sickness due to drinking

questions.question: How did Sultan Qutb-ud-din Aibak die? [2003]
choices: He was treacherously stabbed to death by one of his ambitious nobles
Hewas killed in a battle with Taj-u-din Yildiz, the ruler ofGhazni who entered into a contest with him over the capture of Punjab
He sustained injuries while besieging the fortress of Kalinjar in Bundelkhand and succumbed to them later
Hedied after a fall from his horse while playing Chaugan

questions.question: Which one of the following sequences indicates the correct chronological order? [2004]
Who was the last ruler of the Tughlaq dynasty of the Delhi Sultanate? [2004]
How did the dynasty of Nizam Shahis of Ahmadnagar come to an end? [2004]
choices: Ahmadnagar was annexed into Mughal empire and Hussain Shah was given life imprisonment
Mughal troops destroyed Daulatabad fort and killed Nizam-ul Mulk ofAhmadnagar
Fateh Khan usurped the throne from Nizam-ul-Mulk
Malik  Ambar was defeated in a battle with Mughals in 1631 and the entire royal family was killed by the Mughal troops

questions.question: The initial design and construction of which massive temple took place during the reign of Suryavarman II? [2006]
When Raja Wodeyar founded the kingdom of Mysore, who was the ruler of the Vijayanagar Empire? [2006]
In the year 1613, where was the English East India Company given permission to set up a factory (trading post)? [2006]

Bhakta Tukaram was a contemporary of which Mughal emperor?   [2006]
In Indian history, who was Abdul Hamid Lahori? [2006]
choices: An important military commander during Akbar reign.
An official historian ofthe reign of Shahjahan.
An important noble and confidant of Aurangzeb.
A chronicler and poet during the reign of Muhammad Shah.

questions.question: Where is the famous Vijaya Vittala temple having its 56 carved pillars emitting musical notes located?  [2007]

In Medival India, the designations 'Mahattara' and 'Pattakila' were used for [UPSC 2014  ]
Ibadat Khana at Fatehpur Sikri was ___________.     [UPSC 2015  ]
choices: a) the mosque for the use of Royal Family
the hall in which Akbar held discussions with scholars of various religions.
the room in which the nobles belonging in different religions gathered to discuss religious affairs.

questions.question: Consider the following rivers : ⏩ 1. Barak ⏩ 2. Lohit ⏩ 3. Subansiri.   ⏩ Which of the above flows/flow through Arunachal Pradesh ? [UPSC 2015  ]

With reference to the cultural history of medieval India, consider the following statements: ⏩ 1. Siddhas (Sitars) of Tamil region were monotheistic and condemned idolatry. ⏩ 2. Lingayats of Kannada region questioned the theory of rebirth and rejected the caste hierarchy. ⏩ Which of the statements given above is/are correct?    [UPSC 2016 ]
Banjaras during the medieval period of Indian history were generally __________.     [UPSC 2016 ]
Which one of the following was a very important seaport in the Kakatiya kingdom?  [UPSC 2017 ]

With reference to the religious history of India, consider the following statements: ⏩ 1. Sautrantika and Sammitiya were the sects of Jainism. ⏩ 2. Sarvastivadin held that the constituents of phenomena were not wholly momentary, but existed forever in a latent form. ⏩ Which of the statements given above is/are correct?  [UPSC 2017 ]

With reference to Mughal India, what is/are the difference/differences between Jagirdar and Zamindar? ⏩ 1. Jagirdars were holders or land assignments in lieu of judicial and police duties, whereas Zamindars were holders of revenue rights without obligation to perform any duty other than revenue collection. ⏩ 2. Land assignments to Jagirdars were hereditary and revenue rights or Zamindars were not hereditary. ⏩ Select the correct answer using the code given below.     [UPSC 2019  ]

With reference to Mian Tansen, which one of the following statements is not correct?     [UPSC 2019 ]
choices: Tansen was the title given to him by Emperor Akbar.
Tansen composed Dhrupada on Hindu gods and goddesses.
Tansen composed songs on his patrons

questions.question: Who among the following Mughal Emperors shifted emphasis from illustrated manuscripts to album and individual portrait?    [UPSC 2019 ]
Which of the following phrases defines the nature of the Hundi' generally referred to in the sources of the post- Harsha period?      [UPSC 2020  ]
choices: An advisory issued by the king to his subordinates
A diary to be maintained for daily accounts
An order from the feudal lord to his subordinates

questions.question: Consider the following statements : ⏩ 1. It was during the reign of Iltutmish that Chengiz Khan reached the Indus in pursuit of the fugitive Khwarezm prince. ⏩ 2. It was during the reign of Muhammad bin Tughlug that Taimur occupied Multan and crossed the Indus. ⏩ 3. It was during the reign of Deva Raya II of Vijayanagara Empire that Vasco da Gama reached the coast of Kerala. ⏩ Which of the statements given above is/are correct?     [UPSC 2021  ]

The Mysore Kingdom emerged out of Vijayanagara Empire. ⏩ 3. Rohilkhand Kingdom was formed out of the territories occupied by Ahmad Shah Durrani. ⏩ Select the correct answer using the code given below.     [UPSC 2021  ]
